revealed_symptoms.spontaneous bleeding: Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.
revealed_symptoms.satellite lesions: There are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.
revealed_symptoms.diameter >6mm: It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing.
revealed_symptoms.erythema: The skin around it looks red or puffy, like it’s irritated or reacting to something.

hidden_symptoms.telangiectasia: There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before.
hidden_symptoms.induration: It feels thicker or harder than the rest of my skin, like there's something under there.
hidden_symptoms.nodule formation: It’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles.
hidden_symptoms.pruritus: It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin.
hidden_symptoms.ulceration: It’s like a cut or sore that just won’t heal, and sometimes it scabs over but comes right back.
hidden_symptoms.hyperkeratosis: There's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels.
hidden_symptoms.rapid growth: I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks.
hidden_symptoms.color variation: It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in.

patient_history.content: Hi, I'll be your doctor today. What brings you in?

Well, there's this spot I've been watching. Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it. It’s also got these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading, and it’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing. The skin around it looks red or puffy, like it’s irritated or reacting to something.
Thank you for providing that information. I'm concerned about the bleeding spot. Does it hurt at all? Also, how long have you noticed this spot?
It doesn’t really hurt, no. I’ve noticed it for a few months now, I think. It seemed small at first, and now it's… well, bigger.

Thank you. Since it's been there for a few months and seems to be getting bigger, I'd like to ask if anyone in your family has ever had skin cancer. Also, have you noticed any other symptoms, like feeling tired or having any swollen lymph nodes?
No one in my family has had skin cancer, as far as I know. And no, I haven’t noticed any swollen lymph nodes or feeling tired.

Thank you. Given the information you've provided, I'm leaning towards the possibility of skin cancer. To get a clearer picture, can you describe the appearance of the spot in more detail, like its shape, color, and texture? Also, how much sun exposure do you typically get?
Well, it's got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in. And it’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles.
Thank you. The description of multiple colors and a raised appearance is concerning. How much sun exposure do you typically get? Have you ever used tanning beds?
I try to stay out of the sun when I can, but I do like to be outside. And no, I don't use tanning beds.
Thank you. Given the information you've provided, it's important to determine if you've tried any treatments for the spot, even over-the-counter ones.
No, I haven't tried anything on it.

The skin around it looks red or puffy, like it’s irritated or reacting to something.
